quiz.title: Unit 6: Monopoly (Quiz 6)
quiz.subtitle: AP Microeconomics — Graph Interpretation, FRQ-Style Math, and Advanced Concepts
quiz.subject: AP Microeconomics
quiz.topic: Monopoly Graph Analysis, Numerical Optimization, Elasticity, Government Intervention

questions.question: On a monopoly graph, the area representing deadweight loss is bounded by:
options: Demand, MC, and the monopoly quantity
Demand, MC, and the competitive quantity
MR, MC, and the monopoly quantity
P, ATC, and the monopoly quantity
questions.explanation: Deadweight loss is the triangle between the demand curve (MB), MC curve, and the difference between competitive (where P=MC) and monopoly output.

questions.question: A monopoly faces demand P = 50 – Q and has MC = 10. What is the profit-maximizing price?
If a monopolist practices perfect price discrimination, consumer surplus becomes:
questions.explanation: Perfect price discrimination allows the monopolist to capture all consumer surplus, leaving consumers with none.

questions.question: A monopolist’s profit is maximized where:
options: The slope of the total revenue curve equals the slope of the total cost curve
questions.explanation: Profit is maximized where MR = MC, which corresponds to equal slopes of TR and TC curves.

questions.question: If demand for a monopoly’s product becomes more elastic, the profit-maximizing price will:
questions.explanation: More elastic demand means consumers are more price-sensitive; the monopolist will lower price to maximize profit.

questions.question: A natural monopoly with ATC declining over the relevant range will have:
questions.explanation: If ATC is falling, marginal cost must be below average total cost (MC < ATC).

questions.question: If the government imposes a price ceiling at the competitive level on a monopolist, the monopolist will produce where:
questions.explanation: A binding price ceiling at the competitive price forces P = MC, leading the monopolist to produce the socially optimal output.

questions.question: For a monopoly, the Lerner Index ( (P – MC)/P ) is equal to:
questions.explanation: The Lerner Index measures market power and equals the inverse of the absolute value of price elasticity of demand.

questions.question: A monopolist in long-run equilibrium may not produce at minimum ATC because:
questions.explanation: Without competitive pressure, a monopolist may not minimize costs or produce at minimum ATC, leading to X-inefficiency.

questions.question: If a monopoly’s fixed costs increase, the profit-maximizing price and output will:
questions.explanation: Fixed costs affect ATC but not MC or MR, so the profit-maximizing output and price remain the same; only profit changes.

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional ability to interpret graphs, solve monopoly math, and analyze policy impacts.
scoreMessages.70: Strong; review DWL graphical area, Lerner Index, and price ceiling effects.
scoreMessages.50: Fair; revisit elasticity impact on pricing, natural monopoly cost curves, and fixed cost effects.
scoreMessages.0: Needs review: monopoly graphs, numerical optimization, and government interventions.
